arabicText: ثُمَّ أَتْبَعَ سَبَبًا
englishTranslationText: He	again	pursued	a	purpose.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	ek	sāmān	ke	pichhe	chala.

arabicText: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا بَلَغَ بَيْنَ ٱلسَّدَّيْنِ وَجَدَ مِن دُونِهِمَا قَوْمًۭا لَّا يَكَادُونَ يَفْقَهُونَ قَوْلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Until,	 when	 he	 came	 between	 two	
mountains,	he	found	before	them	a	nation	
that	 did	 not	 appear	 to	 understand	 any	
speech.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yahañ	 tak	 ke	 jab	 do	 pahādoñ	 ke	 beech	
pahuñcha	un	se	udhar	kuchh	log	pāye		ke	
koi	bāt	samajhte	m'aloom	na	hote	they	.

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰذَا ٱلْقَرْنَيْنِ إِنَّ يَأْجُوجَ وَمَأْجُوجَ مُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَهَلْ نَجْعَلُ لَكَ خَرْجًا عَلَىٰٓ أَن تَجْعَلَ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَهُمْ سَدًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“O	Zul-Qarnain	- indeed	Yajuj	and	Majuj	*	are	spreading	chaos	in	the	land	– so	shall	
we	assign	 for	 you	a	 consideration	 upon	 the	 condition	 that	 you	 set	 up	a	wall	 between	 us	and	
them?”	(*	Gog	and	Magog.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unhoñ	 ne	 Kahā	 aey	 Zulqarnaiñ!	 be-shak		
Yājuj	 wa	 Mājuj	 zameen	 meiñ	 fasād	
machāte haiñ	to	kya	ham	apke	liye	kuchh	
māl	muqarrar	kar	deñ	us	par	ke	āap	ham	
meiñ	aur	un	meiñ	ek	diwār	bana	deñ.

arabicText: قَالَ مَا مَكَّنِّى فِيهِ رَبِّى خَيْرٌۭ فَأَعِينُونِى بِقُوَّةٍ أَجْعَلْ بَيْنَكُمْ وَبَيْنَهُمْ رَدْمًا
englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “That	 which	 my	 Lord	 has	 given	 me	 control	 over	 is	 better,	 therefore	 help	 me	 with	
strength	- I	shall	set	up	a	barrier	between	you	and	them.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Kahā	woh	jis	par	mujhe	mere	rab	ne	qābu	diya	hai	behtar	hai	to	meri	madad	ṭāqat	se	karo	meiñ	
tum	meiñ	aur	un	meiñ	ek	mazbooṭ ādh	banā	dooñ.

arabicText: ءَاتُونِى زُبَرَ ٱلْحَدِيدِ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا سَاوَىٰ بَيْنَ ٱلصَّدَفَيْنِ قَالَ ٱنفُخُوا۟ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَعَلَهُۥ نَارًۭا قَالَ ءَاتُونِىٓ أُفْرِغْ عَلَيْهِ قِطْرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“Give	 me	 sheets	 of	 iron”;	 until	 when	 he	 had	 raised	 the	 wall	 equal	 to	 the	 edge	 of	 the	 two	
mountains,	 he	 said,	 “Blow”;	 to	 the	 extent	 that	 he	made	it	 ablaze	- he	 said,	 “Bring	me	molten	
copper	to	pour	upon	it.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Mere	pās lohe	ke	takhte	lāo	yahañ	tak	ke	woh	jab	diwār	donoñ	pahadoñ	ke	kināroñ	se	barābar	
kar	di	Kahā	dhonko	yahañ	tak	ke	jab	usey		āag		kar	diya	Kahā	lāo	meiñ	us	par	galā	hua	tāñba	undel	
duñ.

arabicText: فَمَا ٱسْطَـٰعُوٓا۟ أَن يَظْهَرُوهُ وَمَا ٱسْتَطَـٰعُوا۟ لَهُۥ نَقْبًۭا
englishTranslationText: Therefore	Yajuj	and	Majuj	were	neither	able	to	surmount	it,	nor	could	they	pierce	it
romanUrduTranslationText: To	Yajuj	wa	Majuj	us	par	na	chadh	sake	aur	na	us	meiñ	surākh	kar	sake

arabicText: قَالَ هَـٰذَا رَحْمَةٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّى ۖ فَإِذَا جَآءَ وَعْدُ رَبِّى جَعَلَهُۥ دَكَّآءَ ۖ وَكَانَ وَعْدُ رَبِّى حَقًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“This	is	the	mercy	of	my	Lord;	then	
when	 the	 promise	 of	 my	 Lord	 arrives,	 He	
will	blow	it	to	bits;	and	my	Lord’s	promise	
is	true.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	yeh	mere	Rab	ki	Rahmat	hai	phir	jab	
mere	 rab	 ka	w’ada	āayega	 usey	 pāsh	 pāsh	
kar	dega	aur	mere	Rab	ka	w’ada	sachcha	hai.

arabicText: ۞ وَتَرَكْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ يَمُوجُ فِى بَعْضٍۢ ۖ وَنُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَجَمَعْنَـٰهُمْ جَمْعًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 on	 that	 day	We	 shall	 release	 them	 in	
groups	 surging	 like	 waves	 one	 after	
another,	 and	 the	 Trumpet	will	 be	 blown	–
so	We	shall	gather	them	all	together.	(* Gog 
and Magog will come out during the time of 
Eisa (Jesus - when he comes back to earth) and 
cause great destruction in the land.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Aur	us	din	ham	unheñ	chhodh	deñge	ke	un	
ka	ek	giroh	doosre	par	reila	dega	aur	soor	
phoñka	 jāye	 ga	 to	 ham	 un	 sab	 ko	ikat_tha	
kar	lāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: وَعَرَضْنَا جَهَنَّمَ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ لِّلْكَـٰفِرِينَ عَرْضًا
englishTranslationText:
And	 We	 shall	 bring	 hell	 in	 front	 of	 the	
disbelievers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	us	din	Jahannam	kāfiroñ	ke	sāmne	
lāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ كَانَتْ أَعْيُنُهُمْ فِى غِطَآءٍ عَن ذِكْرِى وَكَانُوا۟ لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ سَمْعًا
englishTranslationText:
The	 ones	 whose	 eyes	 were	 covered	 from	
My	remembrance,	and	who	could	not	bear	
to	hear	Truth.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jin	ki	āañkhoñ	par	meri	yād	se	parda	
pada	tha	aur	haq	bāt	sun	na	sakte	they	.

arabicText: أَفَحَسِبَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَن يَتَّخِذُوا۟ عِبَادِى مِن دُونِىٓ أَوْلِيَآءَ ۚ إِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا جَهَنَّمَ لِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ نُزُلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Do	the	disbelievers	assume	that	they	will	be	
able	 to	 choose	 My	 bondmen	 as	 supporters	
other	 than	 Me?	 Indeed	 We	 have	 prepared	
hell	to	welcome	the	disbelievers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.To	 kya	 kāfir	 yeh	 samjhe	 haiñ	 ke	 mere	
bandoñ	ko	mere	siwa	himāyati	bana	leñge?	
be-shak	 ham	 ne	 kāfiroñ	 ki	 mehmāni	 ko	
Jahannam		tayyar	kar	rakhi	hai.

arabicText: قُلْ هَلْ نُنَبِّئُكُم بِٱلْأَخْسَرِينَ أَعْمَـٰلًا
englishTranslationText:
Say	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad – peace	and	
blessings	be	upon	him),	“Shall	we	inform	you	
whose	are	the	most	failed	works?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	 farmāo	 kya	 ham	 tumheñ	 bata	 deñ	 ke	
sab	se	badh	kar	nāqis	‘amal	kin	ke	haiñ.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ ضَلَّ سَعْيُهُمْ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَهُمْ يَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّهُمْ يُحْسِنُونَ صُنْعًا
englishTranslationText:
“Of	 those	whose	efforts	are	lost	in	(pursuit	
of)	the	life	of	this	world,	and	they	think	that	
they	are	doing	good	deeds.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	 ke	 jinki	 sāri	 koshish	 dunya	 ki	 zindagi	
meiñ	gum	gayi	aur	woh	us	khayāl	meiñ	haiñ	
ke	ham	achchha	kām	kar	rahe	haiñ.

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَلِقَآئِهِۦ فَحَبِطَتْ أَعْمَـٰلُهُمْ فَلَا نُقِيمُ لَهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ وَزْنًۭا
englishTranslationText:
The	people	who	disbelieved	in	the	signs	of	
their	 Lord	 and	 in	 the	 meeting	 with	 Him,	
therefore	 all	 their	 deeds	 are	 in	 vain	 –We	
shall	 therefore	 not	 establish	 any	 weighing	
for	them	on	the Day	of	Resurrection.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh		log	jinhoñ	ne	apne	rab	ki	āayateñ	aur	
us	ka	milna	na	māna	to	un	ka	kiya	dharā	sab	
ikārat	(zāye)	to	ham	un	ke	liye	qayāmat	ke	
din	koi	tol	na	qāyim	kareñ	ge.

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ جَزَآؤُهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ بِمَا كَفَرُوا۟ وَٱتَّخَذُوٓا۟ ءَايَـٰتِى وَرُسُلِى هُزُوًا
englishTranslationText:
This	is	their	reward	– hell	- because	they	disbelieved,	and	made	a	mockery	of	My	verses	and	My	
Noble	Messengers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	 un	 ka	 badla	 hai Jahannam	 us	 par	 ke	
unhoñ	 ne	 kufr	 kiya	 aur	 meri	 Āyatoñ	 aur	
mere	Rasooloñ	ki	hañsi	banāyi

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ كَانَتْ لَهُمْ جَنَّـٰتُ ٱلْفِرْدَوْسِ نُزُلًا
englishTranslationText: Indeed	those	who	believed	and	did	good	deeds	– their	welcome	are	the	Gardens	of	Paradise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		ho	Imān lāye	aur	achchhe	kām	kiye	
firdous	ke	bāgh	un	ki	mehmāni	hai

arabicText: خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا لَا يَبْغُونَ عَنْهَا حِوَلًۭا
englishTranslationText: They	will	abide	in	it	for	ever,	never	wanting	to	shift	from	it
romanUrduTranslationText: .Woh	hamesha	un	me	raheñ	ge	un	se	jagah	badalna	nā	chaheñ	ge

arabicText: قُل لَّوْ كَانَ ٱلْبَحْرُ مِدَادًۭا لِّكَلِمَـٰتِ رَبِّى لَنَفِدَ ٱلْبَحْرُ قَبْلَ أَن تَنفَدَ كَلِمَـٰتُ رَبِّى وَلَوْ جِئْنَا بِمِثْلِهِۦ مَدَدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“If	the	sea	became	ink	for	the	Words	of	my	Lord,	the	sea	would	indeed	be	used	up	and	
the	Words	of	my	Lord	would	never	- even	if	we	bring	another	like	it	for	help.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	agar	samandar	mere	Rab	ki	bātoñ	ke	liye	siyāhi	ho	to	zaroor	samandar	khatam	ho	
jāyega	aur	mere	Rab	ki	bāteñ	khatam	na	hoñgi	agarche	ham	waisā	hi	aur	us	ki	madad	ko	le	āayeñ

arabicText: قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ بَشَرٌۭ مِّثْلُكُمْ يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَىَّ أَنَّمَآ إِلَـٰهُكُمْ إِلَـٰهٌۭ وَٰحِدٌۭ ۖ فَمَن كَانَ يَرْجُوا۟ لِقَآءَ رَبِّهِۦ فَلْيَعْمَلْ عَمَلًۭا صَـٰلِحًۭا وَلَا يُشْرِكْ بِعِبَادَةِ رَبِّهِۦٓ أَحَدًۢا
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“Physically	 I	am	a	human	*	like	you	- my	Lord	sends	divine	revelations	 to	me	- that	
your	God	is	only	One	God;	so	whoever	expects	to	the	meet	his	Lord	must	perform	good	deeds	
and	not	ascribe	anyone	as	a	partner	in	the	worship	of	his	Lord.”	(*	Human	but	not	equal	to	you,	
in	fact	the	greatest in	spiritual	status.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	ẓāhir	soorte	bashri	meiñ	to	meiñ	tum	jaisa		hooñ	mujhe	waḥi	āati	hai	ke	tumhāra	
m’abood	ek	hi	m’abood	hai	to	jise	apne	Rab	se	milne	ki	ummid	ho	usey	chahiye	ke	nek	kām	kare	
aur	apne	Rab ki	bandagi	meiñ	kisi	ko	shareek	na	kare

arabicText: كٓهيعٓصٓ
englishTranslationText:
Káf-Ha-Ya-Ain-Şád*.	
(*Alphabets of the Arabic language; Allah
and to whomever He reveals, know their 
precise meanings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Káf-Ha-Ya-Ain-Şád*.	
(*Arab i zabān k Huroof jinke Ma’āni Allah 
or Jis par Allah Ta’āla ne Inko Nazil 
Farmaya Wahi Janta hai.)

arabicText: ذِكْرُ رَحْمَتِ رَبِّكَ عَبْدَهُۥ زَكَرِيَّآ
englishTranslationText:
This	is	 the	 remembrance	 of	 the	mercy	 of	
your	Lord	upon	His	bondman	Zakaria.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh		mazkoor	hai	tere	Rab	 ki	us	Rahmat	ka	
jo	us	ne	apne	bande	Zakariya par	ki.

arabicText: إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥ نِدَآءً خَفِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText: When	he	softly	prayed	to	his	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText: .Jab	us	ne	apne	Rab	 ko	āahista	pukāra.

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّى وَهَنَ ٱلْعَظْمُ مِنِّى وَٱشْتَعَلَ ٱلرَّأْسُ شَيْبًۭا وَلَمْ أَكُنۢ بِدُعَآئِكَ رَبِّ شَقِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
He	 submitted,	 “O	 my	 Lord	 - my	 bones	
have	 become	 weak	 and	 old	 age	 shines	
forth	from	my	head,	and	O	my	Lord,	I	have	
never	 been	disappointed	in	my prayer	 to	
you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Arz	ki	aey	mere	Rab	# Meri	haddi	kamzor	
ho	gayi		aur	sar	se	budhāpe	ka	bhabhooka	
phoota	 (safedi	 ẓahir	 huyi)	 aur	 aey	 mere	
Rab!	Maiñ	tujhe	pukār	kar	kabhi	nā	murād	
na	rahā

arabicText: وَإِنِّى خِفْتُ ٱلْمَوَٰلِىَ مِن وَرَآءِى وَكَانَتِ ٱمْرَأَتِى عَاقِرًۭا فَهَبْ لِى مِن لَّدُنكَ وَلِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
“And	 I	 fear	my	relatives	after	me	and	my	
wife	is	barren	 therefore	bestow	upon	me	
from	 Yourself	 one	 who	 will	 take	 up	 my	
work.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	mujhe	apne	b’ad		apne	qarābat	wāloñ	
ka	 dar	 hai	 aur	 meri	 ‘aurat	 bāñjh	 hai	 to	
mujhe	apne	pās	se	koi	aisā	de	dāl	jo	mera	
kām	uthā	le.

arabicText: يَرِثُنِى وَيَرِثُ مِنْ ءَالِ يَعْقُوبَ ۖ وَٱجْعَلْهُ رَبِّ رَضِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
“He	 being	 my	 successor	 and	 the	 heir	 of	
the	Descendants	of	Yaqub	(Jacob);	and	my	
Lord,	 make	 him	 a	 cherished	 *	 one.”	 (*	
Make	him	a	Prophet	among	the	Descendants	of	Israel.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	 mera	 jānasheen	 ho	 aur	 aulāde	
Yāqoob ka	 wāris	 ho	 aur	 aey	 mere	 Rab!	
Usey		pasandidah	kar.

arabicText: يَـٰزَكَرِيَّآ إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَـٰمٍ ٱسْمُهُۥ يَحْيَىٰ لَمْ نَجْعَل لَّهُۥ مِن قَبْلُ سَمِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
“O	Zakaria!	We	give	you	the	glad	tidings	of	a	son	whose	name	is	Yahya	(John)	- before	him,	We	
have	not	created	anyone	of	this	name.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Zakariya!	Ham	tujhe	khushi	sunāte	haiñ	ek	ladke	ki	jinka	nām	yaḥya	hai	uske	pahle	ham	ne	
us	nām	ka	koi	na	kiya	.

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِى غُلَـٰمٌۭ وَكَانَتِ ٱمْرَأَتِى عَاقِرًۭا وَقَدْ بَلَغْتُ مِنَ ٱلْكِبَرِ عِتِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
He	submitted,	“My	Lord	- how	can	I	have	a	son	whereas	my	wife is	barren	and	I	have	reached	
infirmity	due	to	old	age?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Árz	ki	aey	mere	Rab!	Mere	ladka	skahañ	se	hoga	meri	‘aurat	to	bāñjh	hai	aur	meiñ	budhāpe	se	
sookh	jāne	ki	hālat	ko	pahuñch	gaya!.

arabicText: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ قَالَ رَبُّكَ هُوَ عَلَىَّ هَيِّنٌۭ وَقَدْ خَلَقْتُكَ مِن قَبْلُ وَلَمْ تَكُ شَيْـًۭٔا
englishTranslationText:
He	(the	angel)	said,	“So	it	is;	your	Lord	says,	‘This	is	easy	 for	Me	- in	 fact	I	created	you	before	
this,	at	a	time	when	you	did	not	exist.’	”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Farmāya	aisa	hi	hai	tere	Rab	 ne	farmāya	woh	mujhe	āasān	hai	aur	meiñ	ne	to	us	se	pahle	tujhe	
us	waqt	banāya	jab	tu	kuchh	bhi	na	tha.

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱجْعَل لِّىٓ ءَايَةًۭ ۚ قَالَ ءَايَتُكَ أَلَّا تُكَلِّمَ ٱلنَّاسَ ثَلَـٰثَ لَيَالٍۢ سَوِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“My	Lord,	give	me	a	sign”;	He	said,	“Your	token	is	that	you	will	not	speak	to	people	for	
three	nights,	although	in	proper	health.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Árz	ki	aey	mere	Rab!	Mujhe	koi	nishāni	de	de	farmāya	teri	nishāni	yeh		hai	ke	tu	teen	rāt	din	logoñ	
se	kalām	na	kare	bhala	changa	ho	kar.

arabicText: فَخَرَجَ عَلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ مِنَ ٱلْمِحْرَابِ فَأَوْحَىٰٓ إِلَيْهِمْ أَن سَبِّحُوا۟ بُكْرَةًۭ وَعَشِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
He	therefore	emerged	upon	his	people	from	the	masjid,	and	told	them	through	gestures,	“Keep	
proclaiming	the	Purity	(of	your	Lord)	morning	and	evening.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.To apni	qoum	par	Masjid	se	bāhar	āaya		to	unheñ	ishāre	se	Kahā	ke	subh	o shām	tasbeeh	karte	
raho.

arabicText: يَـٰيَحْيَىٰ خُذِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ بِقُوَّةٍۢ ۖ وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ ٱلْحُكْمَ صَبِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
“O	Yahya	- hold	the	Book	firmly”;	and	We	
gave	 him	 Prophethood	 in	 his	 infancy.	
(Prophet	 Yahya	 was	 only	 2	 years	 old	 at	
that	time.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Yāḥya!	Kitāb	mazboot	 thām	aur	Ham	
ne	usey	bachpan	hi	me	Nabuwwat	di.

arabicText: وَحَنَانًۭا مِّن لَّدُنَّا وَزَكَوٰةًۭ ۖ وَكَانَ تَقِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 compassion	 from	 Ourselves,	 and	
chastity;	and	he	was	extremely	pious.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	apni	ṭaraf	 se	maherbāni	aur	 suthrāyi	
aur	kamāl	dar	wāla	tha	.

arabicText: وَبَرًّۢا بِوَٰلِدَيْهِ وَلَمْ يَكُن جَبَّارًا عَصِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 was	 good	 to	 his	 parents	 and	 not	
forceful,	nor	disobedient.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	apne	māñ	bāp	se	achchha	sulook	karne	
wāla		 tha	aur	zabardast	wa	na	 farmān	na	
tha.

arabicText: وَسَلَـٰمٌ عَلَيْهِ يَوْمَ وُلِدَ وَيَوْمَ يَمُوتُ وَيَوْمَ يُبْعَثُ حَيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 peace	 is	 upon	 him	 the	 day	 he	 was	
born,	and	the	day	he	will	taste	death,	and	
the	day	he	will	be	raised	alive.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	salāmati	hai	us	par	jis	din	paida	huwa	
aur	jis	din	marega	aur	jis	din	zinda	uthāya	
jāye	ga	.

arabicText: وَٱذْكُرْ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ مَرْيَمَ إِذِ ٱنتَبَذَتْ مِنْ أَهْلِهَا مَكَانًۭا شَرْقِيًّۭا
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Kitāb	meiñ	Mariyam ko	 yād	 karo	jab	
apne	 ghar	 wāloñ	 se	 purab (mashriq)	 ki	
ṭaraf	ek	jagah	alag	gayi	.

arabicText: فَٱتَّخَذَتْ مِن دُونِهِمْ حِجَابًۭا فَأَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَيْهَا رُوحَنَا فَتَمَثَّلَ لَهَا بَشَرًۭا سَوِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
So	 there	she	screened	herself	 from	 them;	
We	therefore	sent	Our	Spirit	towards	her	
- he	appeared	before	her	in	 the	 form	of	a	
healthy	 man.	 (Angel	 Jibreel	 – peace	 be	
upon	him.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	un	se	idhar	ek	pardah kar	liya	to	us	ki	
ṭaraf	ham	ne	apna	Roohāni	bheja	woh	us	
ke	sāmne	ek	tandrust	āadmi	ke	roop	meiñ	
ẓāhir	huwa.

arabicText: قَالَتْ إِنِّىٓ أَعُوذُ بِٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ مِنكَ إِن كُنتَ تَقِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
She	 said,	 “I	 seek	 the	 refuge	 of	 the	 Most	
Gracious	from	you	- if	you	fear	God.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Boli	maiñ	tujh	se	Rahmān	ki	panah	māñgti	
hooñ	agar	tujhe	Khuda	ka	dar	hai.

arabicText: قَالَ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ رَسُولُ رَبِّكِ لِأَهَبَ لَكِ غُلَـٰمًۭا زَكِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “I	 am	 indeed	 one	 sent	 by	 your	
Lord;	so	that	I	may	give	you	a	chaste	son.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bola	maiñ	tere	Rab	ka	bheja	huwa	hooñ	ke	
maiñ	tujhe	ek	suthra	beta	dooñ.

arabicText: قَالَتْ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِى غُلَـٰمٌۭ وَلَمْ يَمْسَسْنِى بَشَرٌۭ وَلَمْ أَكُ بَغِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
She	said,	 “How	can	 I	bear	a	son?	No	man	
has	ever	touched	me,	nor	am	I	of	poor	conduct!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Boli	mere	ladka	kahāñ	se	hoga	mujhe	to	na	
kisi	āadmi	ne	hāth	lagāya	na	maiñ	badkār	
hooñ.

arabicText: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ هُوَ عَلَىَّ هَيِّنٌۭ ۖ وَلِنَجْعَلَهُۥٓ ءَايَةًۭ لِّلنَّاسِ وَرَحْمَةًۭ مِّنَّا ۚ وَكَانَ أَمْرًۭا مَّقْضِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“So	it	is;	your	Lord	has	said,	‘This	is	easy	for	Me’;	and	in	order	that	We	make	him	a	sign	
for	mankind	and	a	Mercy	from	Us;	and	this	matter	has	been	decreed.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	yooñ	hi	hai	tere	Rab	ne	farmāya	hai	ke	yeh	mujhe	āasān	hai	aur	is	liye	ke	ham	isey	logoñ	ke	
wāste	nishāni	kareñ	aur	apni	ṭaraf	se	ek	Rahmat	aur	yeh	kām	thaher	chuka	hai.

arabicText: ۞ فَحَمَلَتْهُ فَٱنتَبَذَتْ بِهِۦ مَكَانًۭا قَصِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText: So	she	conceived	him,	and	she	went	away	with	him	to	a	far	place.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ab	Mariyam ne	usey	pet	me	liya	phir	usey	liye	huwe	ek	door	jagah	chali	gayi	.

arabicText: فَأَجَآءَهَا ٱلْمَخَاضُ إِلَىٰ جِذْعِ ٱلنَّخْلَةِ قَالَتْ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى مِتُّ قَبْلَ هَـٰذَا وَكُنتُ نَسْيًۭا مَّنسِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
Then	the	pangs	of	childbirth	brought	her	to	the	base	of	the	palm-tree;	she	said,	“Oh,	if	only	had	I	
died	before	this	and	had	become	forgotten,	unremembered.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	usey	janne	ka	dard	ek	khajoor	ki	jad	meiñ	le	āaya	boli	hāye	kisi	tarah	meiñ	us	se	pehle	mar	
gayi		hoti	aur	bhooli	bisri	ho	jāti.

arabicText: فَنَادَىٰهَا مِن تَحْتِهَآ أَلَّا تَحْزَنِى قَدْ جَعَلَ رَبُّكِ تَحْتَكِ سَرِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
(The	angel)	Therefore	called	her	 from	below	her,	“Do	not	grieve	- your	Lord	has	made	a	river	
flow	below	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	usey	us	ke	tale	se	pukāra	ke	gham	na	kha	be-shak	tere	Rab ne	tere	niche	ek	naher	baha	di	hai.

arabicText: وَهُزِّىٓ إِلَيْكِ بِجِذْعِ ٱلنَّخْلَةِ تُسَـٰقِطْ عَلَيْكِ رُطَبًۭا جَنِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
“And	shake	the	trunk	of	the	palm-tree	towards	you	- ripe	fresh	dates	will	fall	upon	you.”	(This	
was	a	miracle	- the	date	palm	was	dry	and	it	was	winter	season.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	khajoor	ki	jard	pakad	kar	apni	ṭaraf	hila	tujh	par	tāzi	paki	khajooreñ	gireñ	gi.

arabicText: فَكُلِى وَٱشْرَبِى وَقَرِّى عَيْنًۭا ۖ فَإِمَّا تَرَيِنَّ مِنَ ٱلْبَشَرِ أَحَدًۭا فَقُولِىٓ إِنِّى نَذَرْتُ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ صَوْمًۭا فَلَنْ أُكَلِّمَ ٱلْيَوْمَ إِنسِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
“Therefore	 eat	 and	 drink	 and	 appease	
your	eyes;	so	if	you	meet	any	person	then	
say,	 ‘I	 have	 pledged	 a	 fast	(of	 silence)	 to	
the	 Most	 Gracious	 - I	 will	 therefore	 not	
speak	to	any	person	today.’
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	khā	aur	pee	aur	āañkh	thandi	rakh	phir	
agar	 tu	 kisi	 āadmi	 ko	 dekhe	 to	 keh	 dena	
meiñ	ne	āaj		Rahmān	ka	roza	māna	hai	to	
āaj		hargiz	kisi	āadmi	se	bāt	na	karuñgi.

arabicText: فَأَتَتْ بِهِۦ قَوْمَهَا تَحْمِلُهُۥ ۖ قَالُوا۟ يَـٰمَرْيَمُ لَقَدْ جِئْتِ شَيْـًۭٔا فَرِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
So	carrying	him	in	her	arms,	she	brought	
him	 to	her	people;	 they	said,	 “O	Maryam,	
you	have	indeed	committed	a	great	evil!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.To	usey	god	me	liye	apni	qoum	ke	pās	āayi	
bole	 aey	 Mariyam! Be-shak	 	 tu	 ne	 bahut	
badi	bāt	ki.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأُخْتَ هَـٰرُونَ مَا كَانَ أَبُوكِ ٱمْرَأَ سَوْءٍۢ وَمَا كَانَتْ أُمُّكِ بَغِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
. “O	 sister	 of	 Haroon,	 neither	 was	 your	
father	an	evil	man	nor	was	your	mother	of	
poor	conduct!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Hāroon ki	bahen	tera	bāp	bura	āadmi	
na	tha	aur	na	teri	māñ	badkār.

arabicText: فَأَشَارَتْ إِلَيْهِ ۖ قَالُوا۟ كَيْفَ نُكَلِّمُ مَن كَانَ فِى ٱلْمَهْدِ صَبِيًّۭا
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	par	Mariyamne	bachche	ki	ṭaraf	ishārah	
kiya	woh	bole	ham	kaise	bāt	kareñ	us	se	jo	
pālne	meiñ	bachcha	hai

arabicText: قَالَ إِنِّى عَبْدُ ٱللَّهِ ءَاتَىٰنِىَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَجَعَلَنِى نَبِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
The	 child	 proclaimed,	 “I	 am	 Allah’s	
bondman;	He	has	given	me	 the	Book	and	
made	 me	 a	 Herald	 of	 the	 Hidden	 (a	
Prophet).”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bachche	 ne	 farmāya	 maiñ	 hoon	 Allah	 ka	
banda	 us	 ne	 mujhe	 kitāb	 di	 aur	 mujhe	
ghaib	ki	khabreñ	batāne	wāla	(Nabi)	kiya.

arabicText: وَجَعَلَنِى مُبَارَكًا أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُ وَأَوْصَـٰنِى بِٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَٱلزَّكَوٰةِ مَا دُمْتُ حَيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
“And	He	has	made	me	blessed	wherever	I	
be;	 and	 ordained upon	 me	 prayer	 and	
charity,	as	long	as	I	live.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ne	Mujhe	mubārak	kiya	maiñ	kahiñ	
houoñ	aur	mujhe	Namāz wa	Zakāt ki	tākid	
farmāyi	jab	tak	jiyuñ	.

arabicText: وَبَرًّۢا بِوَٰلِدَتِى وَلَمْ يَجْعَلْنِى جَبَّارًۭا شَقِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
“And	 has	 made	 me	 good	 to	 my	 mother	
and	not	made	me	forceful,	ill-fated.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 apni	 māñ	 se	 achchha	 sulook	 karne	
wāla	 aur	 mujhe	 zabardast	 bad	 bakht	 na	
kiya

arabicText: وَٱلسَّلَـٰمُ عَلَىَّ يَوْمَ وُلِدتُّ وَيَوْمَ أَمُوتُ وَيَوْمَ أُبْعَثُ حَيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
“And	peace	is	upon	me	the	day	I	was	born,	
and	on	the	day	I	shall	taste	death,	and	on	
the	day	I	will	be	raised	alive.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 wohi	 salamati	 mujh	 par	 jis	 din	 meiñ	
paida	 huwa	aur	jis	 din	marooñ	ga	aur	jis	
din	zindah	uthāya	jāuoñga.

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ عِيسَى ٱبْنُ مَرْيَمَ ۚ قَوْلَ ٱلْحَقِّ ٱلَّذِى فِيهِ يَمْتَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
This	is	Eisa	(Jesus),	 the	 son	 of	Maryam;	a	
true	statement,	in	which	they	doubt.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Yeh	hai	Ísā	Mariyam ka	beta	sachhi	bāt	jis	
meiñ	shak	karte	haiñ.

arabicText: مَا كَانَ لِلَّهِ أَن يَتَّخِذَ مِن وَلَدٍۢ ۖ سُبْحَـٰنَهُۥٓ ۚ إِذَا قَضَىٰٓ أَمْرًۭا فَإِنَّمَا يَقُولُ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ
englishTranslationText:
. It	 does	 not	 befit	Allah to	 appoint	 someone	 as	His	 son	- Purity	is	 to	Him!	When	He	 ordains	 a	
matter,	He	just	commands	it,	“Be”	- and	it	thereupon	happens.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allah	 ko	 lāyik	 nahiñ	 ke	 kisi	 ko	 Apna	
bachcha	 thehrāye	 pāki	 hai	 us	 ko	 jab	 kisi	
kām	ka	hukm	farmāta	hai	to	yooñ	hi	ke	us	se	farmāta	hai	hoja	woh	fauran	ho	jāta	hai

arabicText: وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ رَبِّى وَرَبُّكُمْ فَٱعْبُدُوهُ ۚ هَـٰذَا صِرَٰطٌۭ مُّسْتَقِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 said	 Eisa,	 “Indeed	 Allah is	 my	 Lord	 and	 your	 Lord	- therefore	 worship	 Him;	 this	 is	 the	
Straight	Path.”
romanUrduTranslationText: .Aur	Ísa	ne	Kahā	be-shak	Allah	Rab hai	mera	aur	tumhāra	to	us	ki	bandagi	karo	yeh	rāh	sidhi	hai.

arabicText: فَٱخْتَلَفَ ٱلْأَحْزَابُ مِنۢ بَيْنِهِمْ ۖ فَوَيْلٌۭ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن مَّشْهَدِ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
englishTranslationText:
Then	groups	among	them	differed;	so	ruin	is	for	the	disbelievers	from	the	witnessing	of	a	Great	
Day.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	jam'āteñ	āpas	meiñ	mukhtalif	ho	gayiñ	to	kharābi	hai	kāfiroñ	ke	liye	ek	bade	din	ki	hāzri	se

arabicText: أَسْمِعْ بِهِمْ وَأَبْصِرْ يَوْمَ يَأْتُونَنَا ۖ لَـٰكِنِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ ٱلْيَوْمَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Much	will	they	listen	and	much	will	they	see,	on	the	Day	when	they	come	to	Us,	but	today	the	
unjust	are	in	open	error.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kitna	suneñ	ge	aur	kitna	dekheñ	ge	jis	din	hamare	pās	hazir	hoñ	ge	magar	āaj	ƶālim	khuli	gumrāhi	
meiñ	haiñ.

arabicText: وَأَنذِرْهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْحَسْرَةِ إِذْ قُضِىَ ٱلْأَمْرُ وَهُمْ فِى غَفْلَةٍۢ وَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	warn	them	of	the	Day	of	Regret	when	
the	 matter	 will	 have	 been	 decided;	 and	
they	are	in	neglect,	and	they	do	not	accept	
faith
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unheñ	dar	sunāo	pachtāwe	ke	din	ka	
jab	kām	ho	chukega	aur	woh	ghaflat	meiñ	
haiñ	aur	woh	nahiñ	mānte.

arabicText: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَرِثُ ٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَنْ عَلَيْهَا وَإِلَيْنَا يُرْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	We	 shall	inherit	 the	 earth	 and	 all	
that	is	on	it,	and	only	towards	Us	will	they	
return.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	 	zameen	aur	jo	 kuchh	 us	 par	 hai	
sab	ke	wāriṣ ham	hoñge	aur	woh	hamāri	hi	
ṭaraf	phireñge.

arabicText: وَٱذْكُرْ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ صِدِّيقًۭا نَّبِيًّا
englishTranslationText:
And	 remember	 Ibrahim	 in	 the	 Book;	 he	
was	very	 truthful,	a	Herald	of	 the	Hidden	
(a	Prophet).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 kitāb	 meiñ	 Ibrāhim ko	 yād	 karo	 beshak	 	 woh	 siddiq	 tha	 ghaib	 ki	 khabreñ	
batata.

arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ يَـٰٓأَبَتِ لِمَ تَعْبُدُ مَا لَا يَسْمَعُ وَلَا يُبْصِرُ وَلَا يُغْنِى عَنكَ شَيْـًۭٔا
englishTranslationText:
When	he	said	to	his	father,	*	“O	my	father	
- why	 do	 you	worship	 one	which	 neither	
hears	nor	sees,	and	cannot	benefit	you	in	
any	way?”	(*	His	uncle	Azar.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Jab	apne	bāp	se	bola	aey	mere	bāp!	Kyuñ		
aise	ko	poojta	hai	jo	na	sune	na	dekhe	aur	
na	kuchh	tere	kām	āaye	.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَبَتِ إِنِّى قَدْ جَآءَنِى مِنَ ٱلْعِلْمِ مَا لَمْ يَأْتِكَ فَٱتَّبِعْنِىٓ أَهْدِكَ صِرَٰطًۭا سَوِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
“O	 my	 father,	 indeed	 a	 knowledge	 has	
come	 to	me	which	 did	 not	 come	 to	 you	-
therefore	 follow	 me,	 I	 will	 show	 you	 the	
Straight	Path.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	mere	bāp!	Be-shak	mere	pās	woh	Ílm	
āaya	 jo	 tujhe	 na	 āaya	 to	 tu	 mere	 pichhe	
chala	āa	meiñ	tujhe	sidhi	rāh	dikhāuñ.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَبَتِ لَا تَعْبُدِ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنَ ۖ إِنَّ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنَ كَانَ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عَصِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
“O	my	father,	do	not	be	a	bondman	of	the	
devil;	 indeed	 the	 devil	 is	 disobedient	
towards	the	Most	Gracious.”
romanUrduTranslationText: .Aey	mere	bāp!	Shaitān	ka	banda	na	ban	beshak		shaitān	Rahmān	ka	nā	farmān	h

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَبَتِ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ أَن يَمَسَّكَ عَذَابٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ فَتَكُونَ لِلشَّيْطَـٰنِ وَلِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
“O	my	father,	I	fear	that	a	punishment	from	
the	 Most	 Gracious	 may	 reach	 you,	 so	 you	
would	become	a	companion	of	the	devil.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey mere	 bāp!	 Meiñ	 darta	 hooñ	 ke	 tujhe	
Rahmān	 ka	 koi	 'azāb	 pahuñche	 	 to	 tu	
shaitān	ka	rafiq	ho	jāye

arabicText: قَالَ أَرَاغِبٌ أَنتَ عَنْ ءَالِهَتِى يَـٰٓإِبْرَٰهِيمُ ۖ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ لَأَرْجُمَنَّكَ ۖ وَٱهْجُرْنِى مَلِيًّۭا ٤٦
englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “What!	 You	 turn	 away	 from	 my	
Gods,	 O	 Ibrahim?	 If	 you	 do	 not	 desist,	 I	
will	 certainly	 stone	 you,	 and	 keep	 no	
relation	with	me	for	a	long	while.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Bola	kya	tu	mere	khudāoñ	se	muñh	pherta	
hai	aey	Ibrāhim!	Be-shak		agar	 tu	b’az	na	
āaya	 to	 maiñ	 tujhe	 pathrāo	 karuñga	 aur	
mujh	se	zamana	darāz	tak	be	ílāqa	ho	jā

arabicText: قَالَ سَلَـٰمٌ عَلَيْكَ ۖ سَأَسْتَغْفِرُ لَكَ رَبِّىٓ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ بِى حَفِيًّۭا ٤٧
englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “Stop	 it	 - peace	 be	 upon	 you;	 I	
shall	seek	forgiveness	for	you	from	my	Lord;	indeed	He	is	very	kind	to	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Kahā	bas	tujhe	salām	hai	qarib	hai	ke	maiñ	
tere	liye	apne	Rab se	mu'āfi	māñguñga	beshak woh	mujh	par	maherbān	hai

arabicText: وَأَعْتَزِلُكُمْ وَمَا تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَأَدْعُوا۟ رَبِّى عَسَىٰٓ أَلَّآ أَكُونَ بِدُعَآءِ رَبِّى شَقِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
"And	 I	 shall	 remain	 separated	 from	 you	 and	 all	 that	 you	 worship	 other	 than	Allah and	 shall	
worship	my	Lord;	possibly,	by	worshipping	my	Lord,	I	will	not	be	amongst	the	unfortunate.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	meiñ	ek	kināre	ho	jāuñga	 tum	se	aur	
un	sab	se	jin	ko	Allah	ke	siwa	poojte	ho	aur	apne	Rab	 ko	poojuñ	ga	qarib	hai	ke	maiñ	apne	Rab
ki	bandgi	se	bad	bakht	na	hooñ.

arabicText: فَلَمَّا ٱعْتَزَلَهُمْ وَمَا يَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَهَبْنَا لَهُۥٓ إِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ ۖ وَكُلًّۭا جَعَلْنَا نَبِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
So	 when	 he	 had	 separated	 from	 them	 and	 what	 they	 worshipped	 other	 than	 Allah,	 We	
bestowed	him	Ishaq	and	Yaqub;	and	We	made	each	of	them	a	Herald	of	the	Hidden.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	un	se	aur	Allah	ke	siwa	un	ke	m'āboodoñ	se	kinarah	kar	gaya	ham	ne	usey	ishāq	aur	
Yāqoob ‘aṭa		kiye	aur	har	ek	ko ghaib	ki	khabreñ	batāne	wāla	kiya.

arabicText: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُم مِّن رَّحْمَتِنَا وَجَعَلْنَا لَهُمْ لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ عَلِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText: And	We	gave	them	Our	mercy,	and	assigned	for	them	a	true	and	high	repute.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ham	ne	unheñ	apni	rahmat	‘aṭa		ki	aur	un	ke	liye	sachchi	buland	nāmwari	rakhi

arabicText: وَٱذْكُرْ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ مُوسَىٰٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مُخْلَصًۭا وَكَانَ رَسُولًۭا نَّبِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	remember	Moosa	in	the	Book;	he	was	indeed	a	chosen	one,	and	he	was	a	Noble	Messenger,	
a	Herald	of	the	Hidden.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kitāb	meiñ	Mūsā ko	yād	karo	be-shak	woh	chuna	huwa	tha	aur	Rasool tha	ghaib	ki	khabreñ	
batāne	wāla.

arabicText: وَنَـٰدَيْنَـٰهُ مِن جَانِبِ ٱلطُّورِ ٱلْأَيْمَنِ وَقَرَّبْنَـٰهُ نَجِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
We	 called	 him	 from	 the	 right	 side	 of	 the	
mountain	 Tur,	 and	 brought	 him	 close	 to	
reveal	Our	secret
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	usey	ham	ne	Toor ki	dāhini	jānib	se	nida	
farmāyi	aur	usey	apna	rāz	kahne	ko	qareeb	
kiya.

arabicText: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُۥ مِن رَّحْمَتِنَآ أَخَاهُ هَـٰرُونَ نَبِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 with	 Our	 mercy	 We	 bestowed	 upon	
him	his	brother	Haroon,	a	Prophet.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	apni	Rahmat	se	usey	us	ka	bhai	Hāroon	
‘aṭa	kiya	ghaib	ki	khabreñ	batāne	wāla	Nabi.

arabicText: وَٱذْكُرْ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ إِسْمَـٰعِيلَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ صَادِقَ ٱلْوَعْدِ وَكَانَ رَسُولًۭا نَّبِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 remember	 Ismail	in	 the	 Book;	 he	 was	
indeed	true	to	his	promise	and	was	a	Noble	
Messenger,	a	Prophet.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 kitāb	meiñ	Ismāil	ko	 yād	karo	be-shak		
woh	 w'ade	 ka	 sachcha	 tha	 aur	 Rasool tha	
ghaib	ki	khabreñ	batāta	.

arabicText: وَكَانَ يَأْمُرُ أَهْلَهُۥ بِٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَٱلزَّكَوٰةِ وَكَانَ عِندَ رَبِّهِۦ مَرْضِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
He	 used	 to	 command	 his	 people	 to	 offer	
prayer	 and	 give	 charity,	 and	 was	 liked	 by	
his	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 apne	 ghar	 wāloñ	 ko	 Namāz	 Zakāt ka	
hukm	deta	aur	apne	Rab	 ko	pasand	tha

arabicText: وَٱذْكُرْ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ إِدْرِيسَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ صِدِّيقًۭا نَّبِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 remember	 Idrees	in	 the	Book;	 he	was	
indeed	very	truthful,	a	Prophet.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Kitāb	meiñ	Idris	ko	yād	karo	be-shak		woh		
siddique	tha	Ghaib	ki	khabreñ	deta	.

arabicText: وَرَفَعْنَـٰهُ مَكَانًا عَلِيًّا
englishTranslationText:
And	We	lifted	him	to	a	high	position.	(Living 
with soul & body in heaven, after his 
death.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Ham	 ne	 usey	 buland	 makān	 par	 utha	
liya.

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَنْعَمَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ مِن ذُرِّيَّةِ ءَادَمَ وَمِمَّنْ حَمَلْنَا مَعَ نُوحٍۢ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّةِ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَإِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ وَمِمَّنْ هَدَيْنَا وَٱجْتَبَيْنَآ ۚ إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ خَرُّوا۟ سُجَّدًۭا وَبُكِيًّۭا ۩
englishTranslationText:
It	is	 these	 upon	whom	Allah has	 bestowed	
favour	 among	 the	 Prophets,	 from	 the	
descendants	 of	 Adam;	 and	 from	 those	
whom	 We	 boarded	 along	 with	 Nooh;	 and	
from	the	descendants	of	Ibrahim	and	Israel;	
and	 from	 those	 whom	 We	 guided	 and	
chose;	 when	 the	 verses	 of	 the	 Most	
Gracious	 were	 recited	 to	 them,	 they	 fell	
down,	prostrating	and	weeping.	
(* Command of Prostration # 5.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Yeh	haiñ	jin	par	Allah	ne	ehsān	kiya	Ghaib	ki	
khabreñ	batāne	wālo	meiñ	se	Ādam	ki	aulād	
se	 aur	 un	 meiñ	 jin	 ko	Ham	 ne	 Nūh	 ke	 sāth	
suwār	 kiya	 tha	 aur	 Ibrahim	 aur	 Yāqoob	 ki	
aulād	 se	 aur	 un	meiñ	 se	jinheñ	 ham	 ne	 rāh	
dikhāyi	aur	chun	liya	jab	un	par	Rahmān	ki	
Āyateñ	 padhi	 jātiñ	 gir	 padhte	 Sajdah	 karte	
aur	rote.
(*Sajde	ka	hukm	#5)

arabicText: ۞ فَخَلَفَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِمْ خَلْفٌ أَضَاعُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ ٱلشَّهَوَٰتِ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَلْقَوْنَ غَيًّا
englishTranslationText:
And	 after	 them	 came	 the	 unworthy	
successors	 who	 squandered	 prayer	 and	
pursued	their	own	desires,	so	they	will	soon	encounter	the	forest	of	Gai	in	hell.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.To	un	ke	bā’d		un	ki	jagah	woh	nā	khalf	āaye		
jinhoñ	 nr	 namāzeñ	 gawaiñ	 (zāye	 kiñ)	 aur	
apni	 khuwahishoñ	 ke	 piche	 huwe	 to	 'anqarib	 woh	 dozakh	 meiñ	 ghaiyy	 ka	 jungle	
pāyeñge

arabicText: إِلَّا مَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يَدْخُلُونَ ٱلْجَنَّةَ وَلَا يُظْلَمُونَ شَيْـًۭٔا
englishTranslationText:
Except	those	who	repented	and	accepted	faith	and	did	good	deeds	- so	these	will	enter	heaven,	
and	they	will	not	be	deprived	*	in	the	least.	(*	Of	their	due	reward.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	jo	tāyib	huwe	aur	Imān lāye	aur	achchhe	kām	kiye	to	yeh		log	jannat	meiñ	jāyeñ	ge	aur	
unheñ	kuchh	nuqsān	na	diya	jāye	ga		.

arabicText: جَنَّـٰتِ عَدْنٍ ٱلَّتِى وَعَدَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ عِبَادَهُۥ بِٱلْغَيْبِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ وَعْدُهُۥ مَأْتِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
Everlasting	 Gardens	 of	 Eden,	 which	 the	 Most	 Gracious	 has	 promised	 to	 His	 bondmen	 in	 the	
unseen;	indeed	His	promise	will	come.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Basne	ke	bāgh	jin	ka	w’adā	Rahmān	ne	apne	bandoñ	se	ghaib	meiñ	kiya	be-shak		us	ka	w’ada	āane	
wāla	hai	.

arabicText: لَّا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا إِلَّا سَلَـٰمًۭا ۖ وَلَهُمْ رِزْقُهُمْ فِيهَا بُكْرَةًۭ وَعَشِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
They	will	not	hear	any	lewd	 talk	in	it,	but	only	Peace;	and	in	it	 for	 them	is	sustenance,	every	
morning	and	evening.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	us	meiñ	koi	bekār	bāt	na	suneñge	magar	salām	aur	unheñ	us	meiñ	un	ka	rizq	hai	subh	wa	
shām	.

arabicText: تِلْكَ ٱلْجَنَّةُ ٱلَّتِى نُورِثُ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا مَن كَانَ تَقِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText: It	is	the	Paradise	that	We	will	bequeath	to	those	among	Our	bondmen	who	remain	pious.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	woh	bāgh	hai	jis	ka wāris	Ham	apne	bandoñ	meiñ	se	usey	kareñge	jo	parhez-gār	hai
(aur	Jibrael	ne	mahboob	se	'arz	ki).

arabicText: وَمَا نَتَنَزَّلُ إِلَّا بِأَمْرِ رَبِّكَ ۖ لَهُۥ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِينَا وَمَا خَلْفَنَا وَمَا بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ ۚ وَمَا كَانَ رَبُّكَ نَسِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
(Said	Angel	Jibreel	to	Prophet	Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	them)	“And	we	angels	do	
not	come	down	except	by	the	command	of	your	Lord;	to	Him	only	belongs	all	that	is	ahead	of	us	
and	all	that	is	behind	us	and	all	that	is	between	them;	and	your	Lord	is	not	forgetful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Ham	Farishte	nahiñ	utarte	magar	Huzoor	ke	Rab ke	hukm	se	usi	ka	hai	jo	hamare	āage	hai	aur	jo
hamare	pichhe	aur	jo	us	ke	darmiyān	hai	aur	Huzoor	ka	Rab	 bhoolne	wāla	nahiñ.

arabicText: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فَٱعْبُدْهُ وَٱصْطَبِرْ لِعِبَـٰدَتِهِۦ ۚ هَلْ تَعْلَمُ لَهُۥ سَمِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
Lord	of	the	heavens	and	the	earth	and	all	
that	is	between	them	- therefore	worship	
Him	 and	 be	 firm	 in	 His	 worship;	 do	 you	
know	any	other	of	the	same	name	as	His?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Āsmānoñ	 aur	 zameen	 aur	 jo	 kuchh	 in	 ke	
bich	meiñ	hai	sab	ka	mālik	to	usey	poojo!	
Aur	uski	bandagi	par	sabit	raho	kya	us	ke	
nām	ka	doosra	jānte	ho

arabicText: وَيَقُولُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ أَءِذَا مَا مِتُّ لَسَوْفَ أُخْرَجُ حَيًّا
englishTranslationText:
And	 says	 man,	 “When	 I	 am	 dead,	 will	 I	
soon	be	brought	forth	alive?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	āadmi	kahta	hai	kya	jab	maiñ	mar	jāuñ	
ga	to	zaroor	‘an-qareeb	jila	kar	nikāla	jāuñ	
ga?

arabicText: أَوَلَا يَذْكُرُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ أَنَّا خَلَقْنَـٰهُ مِن قَبْلُ وَلَمْ يَكُ شَيْـًۭٔا
englishTranslationText:
Does	not	man	remember	that	We	created	
him	before	this,	and	he	was	non	existent?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kya	ādmi	ko	yād	nahiñ	ke	ham	ne	us	se	
pehle	usey	banāya	aur	woh	kuchh	na	tha.

arabicText: فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَحْشُرَنَّهُمْ وَٱلشَّيَـٰطِينَ ثُمَّ لَنُحْضِرَنَّهُمْ حَوْلَ جَهَنَّمَ جِثِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
So	by	your	Lord,	We	shall	assemble	them	
and	 the	 devils	 - all	 of	 them	 - and	 bring	
them	around	hell,	fallen	on	their	knees.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 tumhāre	Rab	ki	qasam	ham	inheñ	aur	
shaitānoñ	 sab	 ko	 gher	 lāyeñ	 ge	 aur	 inhe	
dozakh	ke āas	pās	hāzir	kareñ	ge	ghutnoñ	
ke	bal	gire.

arabicText: ثُمَّ لَنَنزِعَنَّ مِن كُلِّ شِيعَةٍ أَيُّهُمْ أَشَدُّ عَلَى ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عِتِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
We	 shall	 then	 pick	 out	 from	 every	 group	
the	 one	 who	 was	most	 arrogant	 towards	
the	Most	Gracious.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	ham	har	giroh	se	nikāleñ	ge	jo	un	meiñ	
rahmān	par	sab	se	ziyāda	bebāk	hoga.

arabicText: ثُمَّ لَنَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ أَوْلَىٰ بِهَا صِلِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
Moreover,	We	well	know	those	who	most	
deserve	to	be	burned	in	hell.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	ham	khoob	jānte	haiñ	jo	us	āag		meiñ	
bhunne	ke	ziyada	lāyiq	haiñ

arabicText: وَإِن مِّنكُمْ إِلَّا وَارِدُهَا ۚ كَانَ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ حَتْمًۭا مَّقْضِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 there	 is	 none	 among	 you	 who	 shall	
not	 pass	 over	 hell;	 this	 is	 an	 obligatory	
affair,	binding	upon	your	Lord.	(Allah will	
make	everyone	pass	over	the	back	of	hell	-
on	a	thin	bridge.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 tum	meiñ	 koi	aisa	 nahiñ	jis	 ka	guzar	
dozakh	par	na	ho	tumhāre	Rab	ke	zimme	
par	yeh		zaroor	thahri	huyi	bāt	hai.

arabicText: ثُمَّ نُنَجِّى ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوا۟ وَّنَذَرُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ فِيهَا جِثِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
We	shall	then	rescue	the	pious	- and	leave	
the	unjust	in	it,	fallen	on	their	knees.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	 ham	 dar	 wāloñ	 ko	 bacha	 leñge	 aur	
ƶālimoñ ko	us	meiñ	chhod	deñge	ghuthnoñ	
ke	bal	gire.

arabicText: وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتُنَا بَيِّنَـٰتٍۢ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ أَىُّ ٱلْفَرِيقَيْنِ خَيْرٌۭ مَّقَامًۭا وَأَحْسَنُ نَدِيًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	when	Our	clear	verses	are	recited	 to	
them,	the	disbelievers	say	to	the	Muslims,	
“Which	 group	 has	 a	 better	 home,	 and	 a	
better	alliance?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jab	 un	 par	 hamāri	 raushan	 āayateñ	
padhi	jāti	haiñ	kāfir	Musalmānoñ		se	kahte	
haiñ	kaun	se	giroh	ka	makān	achchha	aur	
majlis	behtar	hai

arabicText: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هُمْ أَحْسَنُ أَثَـٰثًۭا وَرِءْيًۭا ٧٤
englishTranslationText: And	many	a	generation	We	did	destroy	before	them,	who	exceeded	them	in	wealth	and	pomp!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	un	se	pehle	kitni	sangateñ	khapā	diñ	ke	woh	un	se	bhi	sāmān	aur	numood	(dekhne)	
meiñ	bahtar	they	.

arabicText: قُلْ مَن كَانَ فِى ٱلضَّلَـٰلَةِ فَلْيَمْدُدْ لَهُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ مَدًّا ۚ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوْا۟ مَا يُوعَدُونَ إِمَّا ٱلْعَذَابَ وَإِمَّا ٱلسَّاعَةَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ شَرٌّۭ مَّكَانًۭا وَأَضْعَفُ جُندًۭا ٧٥
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“For	one	in	error	- so	the	Most	Gracious	may	give	him	respite;	to	the	extent	that	when	
they	 see	 the	 thing	which	 they	are	promised	- either	 the	punishment	 or	 the	 Last	Day;	 so	 then	
they	will	come	to	know	for	whom	is	the	evil	rank	and	whose	army	is	weak.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	jo	gumrāhi	meiñ	ho	to	usey	Rahmān	khoob	dheel	de	yahañ	tak	ke	jab	woh	dekheñ	
woh	cheez	jis	ka	unheñ	w'ada	diya	jāta	hai	ya	to	‘aƶāb	ya	Qayāmat	to	ab	jān	leñ	ge	ke	kis	ka	burā	
darjā	hai	aur	kis	ki	fouj	kamzor.

arabicText: وَيَزِيدُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱهْتَدَوْا۟ هُدًۭى ۗ وَٱلْبَـٰقِيَـٰتُ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتُ خَيْرٌ عِندَ رَبِّكَ ثَوَابًۭا وَخَيْرٌۭ مَّرَدًّا
englishTranslationText:
And	Allah will	increase	 the	 guidance	 for	 those	 who	 have	 received	 guidance;	 and	 good	 deeds	
that	remain	have	the	best	reward	before	your	Lord,	and	the	best	outcome.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jinhoñ	ne	hidāyat	pāyi	Allah	unheñ	aur hidāyat	badhāyega	aur	bāqi	rahne	wāli	nek	bātoñ	ka	
tere	Rab ke	yahañ	sab	se	behtar	ṣawāb	aur	sab	se	bhala	anjām.

arabicText: أَفَرَءَيْتَ ٱلَّذِى كَفَرَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَقَالَ لَأُوتَيَنَّ مَالًۭا وَوَلَدًا
englishTranslationText:
So	 have	 you	 seen	 him	 who	 denied	 Our	
signs	and	 says,	 “I	 shall	 certainly	 be	given	
wealth	and	children?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 kya	 tum	 ne	 usey	 dekha	 jo	 hamāri	
āayatoñ	 se	 munkir	 huwa	 aur	 kahta	 hai	
mujhe	zaroor	māl	wa	aulād	mileñ	ge?

arabicText: أَطَّلَعَ ٱلْغَيْبَ أَمِ ٱتَّخَذَ عِندَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عَهْدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Has	he	seen	the	Hidden,	or	has	he	made	a	
pact	with	the	Most	Gracious?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hargiz	nahiñ	ab	ham	likh	rakheñge	jo	woh	
kahta	 hai	 aur	 usey	 khoob	 lamba	 ‘aƶāb		
deñge.

arabicText: كَلَّا ۚ سَنَكْتُبُ مَا يَقُولُ وَنَمُدُّ لَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلْعَذَابِ مَدًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
Never;	We	shall	now	record	what	he	says	
and	give	him	a	prolonged	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
.Aur	jo	cheezeñ kah	raha	hai	un	meiñ	hamiñ	
wāriṣ hoñge	.

arabicText: وَنَرِثُهُۥ مَا يَقُولُ وَيَأْتِينَا فَرْدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	it	is	We	 only	Who	shall	inherit	what	
he	says	(belongs	to	him),	and	he	will	come	
to	Us,	alone.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hamāre	pās	akela	āayega	aur	Allah	ke	
siwa	aur	khuda	bana	liye	ke	woh	unheñ	zor	
de.

arabicText: وَٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ءَالِهَةًۭ لِّيَكُونُوا۟ لَهُمْ عِزًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	 they	 have	 chosen	 Gods	 besides	Allah,	
so	that	they	may	provide	them	strength!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hargiz	nahiñ	koi	dam	jāta	hai	ke	woh	un	ki	
bandgi	 se	 munkir	 hoñ	 ge	 aur	 un	 ke	
mukhālif	ho	jāyeñge	.

arabicText: كَلَّا ۚ سَيَكْفُرُونَ بِعِبَادَتِهِمْ وَيَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِمْ ضِدًّا
englishTranslationText:
Never;	 soon	 they	 will	 deny	 ever	
worshipping	them,	and	will	turn	into	their	
opponents.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kya	tum	ne	na	dekha	ke	ham	ne	kāfiroñ	par	
shaitān	 bheje	 ke	 woh	 inheñ	 khoob	
uchhālte	haiñ.

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينَ عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ تَؤُزُّهُمْ أَزًّۭا ٨٣
englishTranslationText:
Did	you	not	see	 that	We	sent	devils	upon	
the	 disbelievers,	 so	 they	 excite	 them	
abundantly?
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 tum	 in	 par	 jaldi	 na	 karo	 ham	 to	 in	 ki	
ginti	poori	karte	haiñ.

arabicText: فَلَا تَعْجَلْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا نَعُدُّ لَهُمْ عَدًّۭا
englishTranslationText:
So	 do	 not	 be	 impatient	 for	 them	(O	 dear	
Prophet	Muhammad - peace	 and	 blessings	
be	 upon	 him);	 We	 are	 only	 completing	
their	 number.	 *	 (* The number of days 
left for them or their evil deeds.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	 din	 ham	 parhezgāroñ	 ko	 Rahmān	 ki	
ṭaraf	le	jāyeñge	mehmān	bana	kar.

arabicText: يَوْمَ نَحْشُرُ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ إِلَى ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ وَفْدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
On	 the	 day	 when	 We	 shall	 assemble	 the	
righteous	 towards	 the	 Most	 Gracious,	 as	
guests.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	mujrimoñ	ko	Jahannam	ki	ṭaraf	hākeñge	piyāse.

arabicText: وَنَسُوقُ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ وِرْدًۭا
englishTranslationText: And	drive	the	guilty	towards	hell,	thirsty.
romanUrduTranslationText: Log	shafā'at	ke	mālik	nahiñ	magar	wohi	Rahmān	ke	pās	qarār	kar	rakha	hai.

arabicText: لَّا يَمْلِكُونَ ٱلشَّفَـٰعَةَ إِلَّا مَنِ ٱتَّخَذَ عِندَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ عَهْدًۭا
englishTranslationText:
. People	do	not	own	 the	right	 to	intercede,	except	 those	*	who	have	made	a	covenant	with	 the	
Most	 Gracious.	 (* The Holy Prophets and virtuous people will be given the permission to 
intercede. Prophet Muhammad - peace and blessings be upon him - will be the first to 
intercede.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Log	shafā'at	ke	mālik	nahiñ	magar	wohi	Rahmān	ke	pās	qarār	kar	rakha	hai.

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ ٱتَّخَذَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ وَلَدًۭا
englishTranslationText: And	the	disbelievers	said,	“The	Most	Gracious	has	chosen	an	offspring.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	kāfir	bole	rahmān	ne	aulād	ikhtiyār	ki	.

arabicText: لَّقَدْ جِئْتُمْ شَيْـًٔا إِدًّۭا
englishTranslationText: You	have	indeed	brought	an	extremely	grave	speech!
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak		tum	had	ki	bhāri	bāt	lāye
